content.description: Start up friction slab clipping bolts as you go until you reach the head wall. Like the route next door, the climbing is relatively easy, culminating with a crux mantle. Crimp your way up the headwall and then a techy mantle guards the chains.  TR can also be easily set up by scrambling up the backside.
content.location: West face of Warrior’s Rock. 4th route from the right.

content.description: Named for the 13 veterans who participated in the original Warrior's Rock event at Castle Rock.  Start just left of the tree.  Friction up some slab to a final crux on a steeper face just before the chains.
content.location: Climber's right side of Warrior's Rock.

content.description: Climb up and over some slabby ledges to a final, short headwall. Pull the eggshell patina to the chains.
content.location: West face of Warrior's Rock. 2nd route from climbers right.

content.description: A nice kid route to set up a TR on.  Starts with a slippery slab crux right off the ground (can boost them past it).  After the crux, follow the 5.0- crack to the top.  Do not damage the tree in the crack! Gear anchor can be made just over the edge from a couple cracks (lowest ~0.5-0.75 C4, and upper crack 1-2ish).  Walk off down easy slab to your left, or rap from chains of other routes.  You can also easily set up a TR anchor by walking up the backside.
content.location: Far left of Warrior's Rock. Follow obvious low angle crack.

content.description:
Start up easy slab past a low crack. No pro is needed here. Above the crack, start clipping bolts and head up to the ledge. When you reach the ledge, stand up and snag the lip. Compression, thumberclings etc can help you be static here. Grab a crimp just over the lip and to the right. If you’re normal height you can clip the bolt on top of the ledge from here. Get your feet up and mantle onto the ledge (crux). Wander up more easy slab to a small roof. Grab jugs and pull up and over roof to the chains.

The climb was bolted by Diana Lincoln-Haye, Stan Haye and Caleb Hopwood June 2019
content.location: West face of Warrior’s Rock. 3rd route from the right.
